page.title: 01TOPOGRAPHY, SETTLEMENT
page.content: The area lies across rolling chalk downland on the southern edge of Salisbury Plain, and is used mainly for agriculture. A winterbourne at a mean elevation of 9O metres runs through Chitterne in the north east to the centre of the southern edge. The highest point of land is 168 metres. Two of the farmhouses and 44 other dwellings are within part of Chitterne, a village bisected by the northern edge of the boundary.The total population of the village is about 2OO, with a shop, church, pub, small garage and a builder's business, although only the latter three are situated in this area. The two other farmhouses and the fish packaging factory are accessible from the Chitterne to Codford road, separate from the village.
